alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Gallatin; Wabash; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 11:02AM CDT until April 10 at 10:25AM CDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Montezuma...and at Terre Haute to Mount Carmel. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River at Montezuma...and at Terre Haute to Mount Carmel. Moderate flooding is occurring at Mount Carmel...and is forecast to continue through Tuesday. The slow crest on the Wabash River will continue between Riverton and Vincennes today. Minor flooding may resume at Lafayette and Covington on Sunday. Flooding will continue for much of the Wabash into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, APRIL 10... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until Monday, April 10. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, Extensive lowland flooding in progress. Much of the flood plain activity is affected by high water. Numerous local river roads flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Friday /10:45 AM EDT Friday/ the stage was 25.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Friday /10:45 AM EDT Friday/ was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, April 09. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated late this evening.
